reviews.text: From the check-in all the way through until I departed this was a fantastic hotel experience. I am in the hospitality business so I have a trained eye for many things...this hotel exceeded all of my expectations. It really is the only option when I visit Mexico City. I've stayed in two other luxury hotels in this city and neither compare to the Four Seasons!
reviews.title: The only option when visiting Mexico City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely beautiful! Nothing better compared to in Mexico City. We stayed the weekend and it was crazy. The band One Direction stayed at the hotel with us and all the fans made so much noise and there was millions of them. In the end we met the band. Overall the hotel was amazing. They did a good job to still make sure we enjoyed our comfort.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: Within 8 days of vacation we stayed at Four Seasons 2 separate times. The first room was beautiful, though the halls throughout the hotel were stuffy and musty smelling. There is also a building going up next door that , tho not the fault of Four Seasons, makes it very noisy should you open your windows. The coffee pot in room is wonderful, however, after 2 cups, the cost is 4.00 USD per cup. Still, we enjoyed our 1st stay immensely . Our 2nd stay was somewhat different. Our room, tho smaller, was actually a better layout. However the air conditioning did not work properly even after maintenance came to repair. When making reservations, we reserved hypoallergenic bedding, which was forgotten, twice. Although these complaints are miner, the biggest complaint was at checkout. We were charged over 100.00 USD OVER what I was quoted at the time of reservation. After multiple e-mails back and forth, to correct the charges, we were told" however, we don't make any refunds if discrepancies exist. " this is a direct quote from my last e-mail from Four Seasons. All in All , on our next trip to beautiful Mexico City, we will not be staying at Four Seasons.
reviews.title: "We don't offer refunds"

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights at the Four Seasons on a business trip. The property is beautiful. The breakfast buffet was delicious best fresh mango! Only issue was the WIFI in the hotel room was not very reliable
reviews.title: Four Seasons in Mexico City is beautiful!
On the cusp of brilliance
reviews.text: The Four Seasons Mexico City is a beautiful hotel that is almost a five star place. I definitely plan on coming back here and hope it is even better when I visit again.

This is an excellent choice in Mexico City. Friendly staff and beautifully decorated. No downsides apart from the pretty steep prices. Would certainly recommend this place to others. There are more otels nearby but I think this is the best choice
reviews.title: Beautiful and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I traveled to Mexico City for Memorial Day weekend. We very much enjoyed our experience. As with any Four Seasons, the service was top notch. Our room overlooked the BEAUTIFUL court yard. We ate a couple of meals at the hotel restaurant, but if you can, I would highly recommend leaving the hotel to grab some authentic Mexican cuisine instead. Bon Appetit and Travel & Leisure just recenlty had articles on Mexico City, and my husband and I tried almost every restaurant and bar recommendation. I would definitley recommend this hotel to future Mexico City travelers.
reviews.title: Very Pretty Hotel

reviews.text: Cons: Construction right next door. They charge for Wi-Fi (which seems silly)
reviews.title: I Always Look Forward to My Time Here

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Four Seasons Mexico City about to times over the past couple of years. It is always a delight. The staff is friendly, polite and professional. The building is very safe and when you walk through the entry gates, you feel at home. In the mornings and evenings, the courtyard restaurant and bar is a welcoming spot which is beautiful. There are a couple cute boutiques in the courtyard as well. I've used the car service repeatedly and have been pleased with the vehicles and drivers. I've travelled around the world and this is one of my favorite hotels.
reviews.title: Great value 5-star hotel

reviews.text: Large, quiet rooms. Great service with a smile (including 4-hr laundry without extra charge.) better value than many other 5-star hotels. Decent gym. The only relative drawbacks are rooms could use a bit of modernization, and restaurant scene not as buzzing as say the InterCon.
reviews.title: Thank you Four Seasons for an amazing experience

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. Safe area, beautiful rooms and well-equipped fitness center. I truly think its top quality is the value both for the room and on-location dining. The tequila flights and education were outstanding.
reviews.title: One of the best in Mexico City

reviews.text: I've never seen a cleaner hotel. My executive suite room was superb (I have attached pictures).
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with minor concerns.

reviews.text: I looked for as much as a scuff mark on the corner base boards and couldn't find any.
reviews.title: Even better than the last time

reviews.text: There were a few concerns. There are two brands of water in the room.
reviews.title: Beautiful, good location, helpful and mindful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was charged approxmately (I'll talk about that later) $8.00 CDN. at check out for two mini
reviews.title: A True 5 Star Experience

reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Mexico City and the Four Seasons Mexico D.F. While the hotel is not as large or posh as some Four Seasons I have stayed at around the world, it is a very well appointed, safe hotel in a busy city. The conceirge and food and beverage staff were wonderful and assisted me in creating a beautiful setting in the courtyard in which to ask my girlfriend to marry. I will agree that the food and drinks at the hotel are rather expensive. The car service and tours were actually reasonable at $28 per hour and the safety and convenience of a professional driver are well worth it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in an interesting city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room furniture is nothing special. However, the beds are wonderful, the bathrooms well appointed and all rooms have flat screen TV's. Common areas quite nice. Only one restaurant but the Bar serves food as well. Courtyard is a beautiful and relaxing setting in a very busy city.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Overall, enjoyed Mexico City and the hotel. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Comfort , dependability , food poisoning and expensive transportation

reviews.text: We enjoyed very much our first stay at a Four Seasons hotel.
reviews.title: Watch out for the Extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Skilled staff, nice room, excellent breakfast, and their courtyard is an oasis of peace in the center of busy Mexico City!
reviews.title: A Wonderful First Anniversary!

reviews.text: The Four Seasons in Mexico City, for all its problems, remains a fantastic hotel. Its value is greatly increased if you book during an off-peak period, when rates can be significantly lower.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is unparalleled. As with many other Four Seasons properties, staff are trained to get to know you and fulfill your needs beyond your expectations. By and large this is the case, particularly if cost is not an issue.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Rate

likes.liked: — comfort of bed and bath and helpful staff

reviews.text: The concierge service, for example, can provide you with a car and driver any time, any day, any hour... if you are willing to pay $28 an hour ($33 if he is to provide explanations), rather than the $11 an hour charged by a regular taxi (which the concierge will be willing to get for you, no questions asked--although it's worth noting that you may get some very un-Four Seasons-like attitude from the bellboys for having the temerity to go the low-class "ordinary taxi" route).
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous !

likes.liked: — Tranquil oasis in a chaotic city
likes.disliked: — Reserve through Four Seasons Website - great extended weekend rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for food, the news is mixed. The service at the Four Seasons bar is excellent if you go when there are few other patrons; it is, otherwise, severely understaffed, leading to frustrated guests.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service is limited in its options; having tried different items from its menus over a period of five days, it is reasonably safe to say that the Italian menu items are mediocre at best. Though beautifully presented, they are nowhere near the level that you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Morning coffee is often stale, evening coffee even worse. In fact, the only saving grace with respect to food in this hotel is a spectacular pastry chef, who serves chocolate croissants that are to die for.
reviews.title: Great get away, even for Mexici Df residents

likes.liked: — Brand new rooms with all modern maenities

reviews.title: Summer vacation with the kids at Four Seasons DF
reviews.text: This is my second stay at this hotel -- it was an impeccable presentation. Picked up by Juan Carlos at the airport -- my first room assignment was too small -switched to a one-bedroom suite that was just right. Traveling with my wife and toddler daughters.

First day spent at the Zoo -- it is world class. Then we swam at the pool and had lunch. Next day, took the kids to Papalote -- the best children's museum I've visited. Then that night we had a babysitter and had dinner in Polanco at Agulia Y Sol. Very sophisticated. Very Mexican. Didn't see any Anglos, but a very sharp staff. Food presentation was excellent. Then for a drink at the Skye Bar -- one call from the concierge. It was very crowded and we were taken to a private table.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed

reviews.text: I must also comment on hotel staff. The concierge is accommodating. I asked Julio for some campaign memorabilia (Lopez-Calderon). In ten minutes, he had a shirt, a hat and two bumper stickers. All gratis. They also arranged babysitting. In that regard, ask for Dulce, who besides working the switchboard, will watch your kids. When we returned from the market at San Angel (do this if you are in D.F. on Saturday), she'd set up all the children's toys and was operating a market. The kids were buying back their toys from Dulce with Mexican money. Very clever and they had fun.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice
Good hotel bad location
reviews.text: Drawbacks? There is not a lot in walking distance of the Four Seasons -- maybe Zona Rosa, but a bit seedy for anything beyond a drink. This is ameliorated as a car will take you anywhere from the hotel.

reviews.title: Great hotel but lack of charm
reviews.text: You get a great location great rooms and the four seasons service. The only thing is that the restaurant is not as good as the rest (But that might just be that Mexicans are really not gourmets).

But in Mexico City there are plenty of alternatives. The Camino Real has definitely not the same level of service but the architecture is great and it has the feeling of what Mexico wanted to send out as a message for the 1976 Olympics. Then You have the Habita, the Condesa DF and the W as valid alternatives as well. So I like the hotel, but I would rather recommend one of the other four hotels.
reviews.title: Fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed this immensely.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but eat somewhere else..

reviews.text: We arrived here at 1am after 18 hours of travelling and had been up for 24 hours. Mexicana Airlines had lost our luggage and the hotel provided us all with emergency supplies at no coat. They also took charge of our lost luggage issue and ensured the next day that it as delivered to our room when it arrived 24 hours later.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — the price of the internet service

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: We had a rate that included breakfast and this was buffet or choice. The hotel was not full but still had a healthy mix of guests- Mexican, European and American. Staff very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely a five star hotel. The rooms are very nice and the amenities are outstanding as well as excellent housekeeping services. This hotel has a good location and we felt very safe on our stay. The staff is helpful and friendly. I almost forgot to mention the bed and pillows have to be some of the most comfortable we have ever slept on.
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: Our next trip to Mexico City we will definitely be staying at The Four Seasons again.
reviews.title: 5 stays, never any problem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After hundreds of hotel stays, this hotel is probably one of my favorites.
reviews.title: Great hotel, better service

reviews.text: I don't think I ever had a problem, and if I had it was self caused and they would help me.
reviews.title: Old world charm meets modern luxury

reviews.text: Want to borrow a bicykle, no problem. They have them on stock.
reviews.title: Excellent location, ultra efficient and friendly.
